summary:
A bug was introduced in v4.1.0 where allocating a new zero-length buffer can
result in the _next_ allocation of a TypedArray in JavaScript not being
zero-filled. In certain circumstances this could result in data leakage via
reuse of memory space in TypedArrays, breaking the normally safe assumption that
TypedArrays should be always zero-filled.
details: data leakage via reuse of memory space in TypedArrays
